basic_info.description: Hello, there üñê I am from South Korea. I once took Cybercrime and Cyber Investigation for my graduate school and found the IT field fasinating. I wanted to know about this field more and just bought a book for Java programming. Until then I quite didn't know how to express my thoughts logically and systematically. Programming not only enables me to code my thoughts but also helps me grow. I am interested in front-end now because it is where I can visualize my thoughts. For those who are reading this message, I hope that we would work together in the near future! :) If you are interested in me, please email me (yoondev83@gmail.com) or check below!

projects.title: Seoul Crime Map (Single)
projects.description: React and React Material-ui are used for the front-end part, and Node.js, Express.js, Mongoose are used for the back-end part. This project is for non-Koreans who are not familiar with South Korea, especially Seoul, to show visualized data so that they would know how Seoul is in a simple way.

projects.title: REBORN (Team)
projects.description: I participated in this project as a front-end developer using React and React Material-ui. It's a blockchain-based project for a used-golf-equipmen platform where you can buy or sell used golf stuff. When users sell their stuff to the platform, they get tokens as a reward, which they can use for buying stuff on the platform.

experience.company: John Jay College of Criminal Justice (CUNY), New York
experience.title: Master of Arts in International Crime and Justice
